revised_title: Restoration of Pelvic Organ Functions in Paraplegic Patients via Implantable Electrical Stimulators
tldr: The article discusses the development of implants that stimulate sacral anterior roots to restore micturition, defaecation, and penile erection in patients with spinal cord injuries. The implants also allow for easier semen collection and may enable implant-driven erections. The author shares observations and new physiological knowledge gained from studying the performance of these implants.
scientific_discipline: Medicine and Health Sciences > Neurology and Neuroprosthetics
